definition: to float/to hover/also written 漂浮

sentences.english: After drinking it, she found herself floating and flew all they way to the moon.
sentences.chinese: 喝下藥之後他發現自己飄浮起來並飛向了月亮。

sentences.english: One of a wizard's most rudimentary skills is levitation or the ability to make objects fly.
sentences.chinese: 巫師最基本的技巧之一是飄浮，或者是讓物體飛起來。

sentences.english: A chicken hawk floats over, looking for home.
sentences.chinese: 一隻雛鷹在空中飄浮，尋找着自己的家。

sentences.english: That elixir wafted to the sky in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 那個妙香飄浮在森林的空中。

sentences.english: Their boats and smilingly float them On the vast deep.
sentences.chinese: 然後微笑地讓他們在深海中飄浮。

sentences.english: You are a non-physical point of consciousness floating in space.
sentences.chinese: 你是在空中飄浮的一個非肉身的意識點。

sentences.english: Days are colored bubbles that float upon the surface of fathomless night.
sentences.chinese: 日是五彩繽紛的氣泡，飄浮在無盡的夜的表面。

sentences.english: Blobs of oil from the massive spill float on the surface of the water.
sentences.chinese: 大量的浮油斑點飄浮在海面上。

sentences.english: The naked eye can see the lantern floating time to25 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 肉眼所能看到天燈飄浮的時間大至在25分鐘。

sentences.english: We are still under the same blue sky…
sentences.chinese: 水印的雲朵，飄浮在藍天上。

sentences.english: Their boats and smilingly float them
sentences.chinese: 然後微笑地讓他們在深海中飄浮。

sentences.english: There is a burning man hovering in the air over a grille in the Smoldering Corpse Bar.
sentences.chinese: 有一個焚燒中的人，飄浮在冒煙屍體酒吧的鐵柵上方。

sentences.english: The small, red world of Rattatak floats in the far Outer Rim like a drop of blood.
sentences.chinese: 紅色的拉塔塔克小行星像一滴血一樣飄浮在外環深處。

sentences.english: Hawking said it was “amazing” to float free, however briefly.
sentences.chinese: 雖然短暫，但霍金說自由飄浮“不可思議”。

sentences.english: White clouds float on the bed-head in a sunny day.
sentences.chinese: 晴空萬里的白雲飄浮牀頭。

sentences.english: After drinking it, she found herself floating and flew all the way to the moon.
sentences.chinese: 喝下藥之後他發現自己飄浮起來並飛向了月亮。

definition: to spiral/to circle/to go around/to hover/to orbit
to move as in a dance/to wave (some implement)/to flourish/(of eyes, hands etc) to dance/to flutter
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
to whisper in sb's ear/a whisper
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
